Reviews.Title: “Everything was great...but the room”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda S
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was phenomenal from the restuarant to the bar, but the room was far from perfect. The biggest issue was the room noise from both the hallway and the street. Also something that they use for laundry causes me to breakout every time I stay there. I'm a Marriott Rewards member but had some difficulty getting my number added to my reservation at the desk. While this was supposed to be all suites, there was no separation between the living area and bed, which makes this just a regular room in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Marriott suites right off I-35”
Reviews.Author: gsimerson
Reviews.Content: My wife, kids, and I stay at this hotel several times a year, and have been for years now. The hotel is conveniently located right off I-35, which may be a demerit for some travelers but we love it. Every room here is a suite with comfy beds, LCD TVs, and a great view of downtown Dallas if you request the right side of the hotel. The business week staff are the best- courteous and accommodating- from whom the weekend staff should take a few pointers. For example, people who are Marriott Elite members and veteran guests should be greeted and accommodated as such. With that said, however, the weekend staff is not bad (still professional, there's just some room for improvement). On the weekend the concierge lounge is not opened either, so be sure to request a breakfast voucher if you are a Marriott Elite member. Kudos to the room service team, who always serves up some of the best cuisine I've had on the road. All in all, my family and I truly enjoy this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Well I hoped the mediocre reviews were wrong....”
Reviews.Author: mhallren
Reviews.Content: The manager is trying to make this hotel better..The desk staff is not helpfull..I expect a property of this size and look to have people who care about what package and rate plan your on..I had to ask the front desk how was I supposed to get my included breakfast...She hadn't even thought about it...I also found out that I had to pay for parking!There was no mention of this when I booked and no way to find this out previous to booking..I rechecked this...I mentioned this to the manager and he gave me no explanation why this is the policy of the hotel to have hidden charges..The hotel's room carpet needed some cleaning but basically it was clean and a nice room..Wifi cost extra... nice bed and nice breakfast buffet...I think there are better value places....look around...

Reviews.Title: “Marriott, really?”
Reviews.Author: Meitzi
Reviews.Content: First time stayed at this Marriott in downtown Dallas. Upon check-in, the only staff was talking on the phone...for 5 minutes! Other staff walked by, no one offered to help. Not impressed with customer service. Strike one! Asked (Booked) for a King bed but only 2 twins ready at the time. Minor, but still, strike two! Note: Requested early check-in during booking. Also called the morning prior to arrival to confirm early check-in. Hmmm... Room was decent and clean. When making a business call, I realized there was no note pad and pen in the room. Minor and acceptable issue. Strike three came when I found out I had to pay for wireless. My understanding is Marriott reward members always get complimentary access. Maybe I have been spoiled by other Marriott chains... and maybe the management at this particular hotel is a spy from Hilton... ><

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Carol60864
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at this hotel for the last 6 plus years when we go to the Dallas market. It is consistently wonderful!!!! The same staff is there year after year and they always remember you. They are the nicest people you will ever meet. The beds are incredible! The restaurant has great food when you don't feel like heading out to eat. I would never stay any place else when going to the market,

Reviews.Title: “If common decency and customer service is required book your room elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Travelchic2012
Reviews.Content: Made a request that almost anyone with basic human kindness would have accommodated. Told yes by the desk clerks and then told no by the manager. No excuse in how we were treated. Will stay elsewhere going forward I don't care to spend my money with a chain that is this mean.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Market Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cherrice
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, comfortable and well appointed rooms and great service. The bonus was the driver of the shuttle. He drove us where ever we needed - saving on cab fare - even gave us a great tour of the Highland park area. Not the least expensive but it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Small inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: mocha2005
Reviews.Content: Stayed there last weekend of 2011. A lot of small inconveniences that took its toll: 1. Cannot make reservations directly with the hotel. The hotel transferred my call first to a young woman who I could not understand. Next transfer was to Marriott business center and not reservations. I had to call the hotel three times to get transferred to reservations. 2. Reserved two double beds in each room. However, upon check in, told they only had a king bed in rooms left. 3. Lamp would not turn on in room. Noticed finally it was unplugged, Telephone would not work. Noticed it had been unplugged as well. 4. Room was very warm upon arrival. Maintenance woman did a good job figuring a/c was not working, and transferred me to another room. 5. Room TVs -- Set on analog and not digital - could not change, and only one remote for each room even though two TVs in each room. 6. No ice in ice machine. Went to bar, got ice, and five cokes. Charged $13.00 for cokes. 7. During check in, after being told there was no double bed rooms left, I was handed an "Elite" member card. When I used the wireless Internet, it stated that as an Elite Member there would be no charge $12.95 for each room. On check out I was told that I was not really an Elite Member so I had to pay the $26.00. 8. Check out was Noon. Front desk reluctantly extended to 1:30. Besides the maintenance lady, there does not seem to be a lot of deep thinking by those who run this property. Not much attention to detail. For $195.00 a room you should receive more.

Reviews.Title: “Fairfield Dressed Up as a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Nut
Reviews.Content: I had the unusual (for me) experience of checking out of one hotel (the Hilton Anatole) and checking in less than 10 minutes later to another (Marriott Suites Market Center). And oh my, what a difference a 1/2 mile makes between these two competing hotels. The only reason this hotel should carry the Marriott brand rather than the Fairfield brand is that this hotel has the higher end tile bathroom and stone countertops, rather than the more plain / inexpensive tile floor and plastic surround bath, and formica countertops. My room was generally old, tired and smelly, and lacked the fine details and cleanliness that I had just walked out of at the Hilton Anatole down the block. I think my corner room at the Hilton had more floor space than the suite at the Marriott, which was probably the equivilant of one and a half small rooms. The mattress was older and thin, and the sheets were stiff. The Marriott Suites Market Center is definitely at the bottom end of the "Marriott" branded ladder, and I wouldn't consider staying there again absent a full and complete remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but don't expect over the top service”
Reviews.Author: keb1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights while working in the Dallas area. I like that every room is a suite, and they all have two new flatscreens (one each in the living room and bedroom). Each room also has a refrigerator, and I think you could get a microwave upon request. Parking is self-parking and uncovered, but I think it might have been free. Fitness center is decent enough with several cardio machines, a few weight machines, and a little room off to the side for streching or free weights. The only complaint that I had was that the service was just okay. One night I picked up a steak on my way home from work, and called down to ask for a set of silverware with a steak knife to be sent up. I was told it would be up "right away". 20 minutes later, I went down to the restaurant to get it myself, but could not find a hostess or anyone to help me there either. I ended up eating my cold steak with a plastic knife and fork. Also there were a couple of times when my room was not serviced when I returned from work (which was fairly late in the day), so that was annoying. For MR members, unlike other Marriott Suites that I have stayed in, this hotel had a concierge lounge, but the food was not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: afclakr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while in Dallas area. Hotel was very clean and staff was very professional. The housekeeping service was very good and kept my room clean and very comfortable. The club lounge was very comfortable and breaksfast / evening snacks were well presented and tasty. Parking at times can be a bit of a strain but it was free and not really enough to complain about. My wireless internet seemed to slow down in the evenings. I had a room facing the highway and even with that, the highway noise wasnt as loud as I thought it would have been. Overall, i would stay here again in a flash without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Party Stay 11.11.11”
Reviews.Author: Drillmom123
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at this location and the room was fine. Only one complaint I have is that the lighting was very dark or dim. The bed was very comfortable and the staff was very attentive to our needs. We had to switch rooms twice as the rooms that they kept giving us (supposed to be non-Smoking) you tell that someone had smoked in the room due to the way it smelled when you first walked in. The room we finally were given was wonderful with no smoking smells at all. There was a wonderful Buffet in the Hotel Restaurant off the lobby that we enjoyed the next morning and they had a Starbucks coffee shop were we purchased great Starbucks coffee. The room was clean and served our needs for the family wedding. We found the location easy to get to as well right off of Stemmons near the Trade and Apparel Mart. I would stay in this location again based on the great customer service and the staff's willingness to meet our needs. I give this hotel a very high rating for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better!”
Reviews.Author: plain-jainTucson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located for business in Dallas. It is clean and functional. The front desk employees are friendly and efficient. Housekeeping leaves a little to be desired. Room was not made up by late afternoon. I was told unless requested, it might only be made up by 5.00pm. Towels are thin to threadbare and cheap. No bottles water in the room on some days. Coffee not always replaced. Response for fresh towels very slow - more than an hour!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chelseaPhoenix
Reviews.Content: stayed last weekend hotel was great' staff were even better' clean and very comfortable beds nice breakfast lots of bars and resturaunts a short distance great

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with easy access to Dallas hot spots”
Reviews.Author: SSHotelman
Reviews.Content: Travel to dallas for the Cowboy games, this hotel is easy to get to from Love field, on and off access to all the freeways. It took 20mins to get to Cowboy Stadium. spent time downtown / Oaklawn area. very convient location. Very clean and friendly hotel. front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Restaurant average, eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Excellent Service & Value”
Reviews.Author: JQuatt21
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Dallas Marriott Market Center Suites Dallas for 3 nights while in Dallas and had booked this property due to the price and the positive reviews that I read here on TripAdvisor. I can safetly say that I was not dissapointed at all. Check in: The Check in process at the front desk was extremely quick and the front desk staff was extremely friendly. Rooms: The rooms were all suite type rooms as our room was divided into three sections. The first section was the living room/desk area where there was a couch, a desk, a small coffee table, mini fridge and small bar sink and flat screen tv. Then the room splits off into two double french doors that leads into the master bedroom and the other into the bathroom. Inside the master bedroom was another flatscreen tv, lots of different types of pillows on the bed, table lamps etc... The bathroom was furnished with bed bath and beyond shampoo's, fresh linens and towels, etc.... The room really felt like a small mini apartment and made you not feel like you were in a hotel room. Pool: The hotel did have a pool but we did not have the time to visit it. Hotel Bar/Restaurant: The hotel did have a bar and a restaurant downstairs. The bar is a little pricey as you are buying drinks in a marriott, however, there was plenty of seating at the bar if you wished to sit down at the actual bar to have a drink or if you wished to have a small table near the bar to have your drinks at. As for the restaurant, we did not have lunch or dinner here, however on the day we were departing, we did have the berakfast buffet and all of the foods, fruits, were all fresh and delicious. Also, the chef making fresh omlets was a very nice treat. Parking: The hotel has plenty of free parking that is onsite. No issues here. Service: Everyone from housekeeping to the front desk, to the servers in the restaurant were all extremely nice, courteous, and professional and should all be very proud of how they conduct themselves as a staff. Sundry Shop: There is a small gift shop/sundry shop open 24 hours next to the front desk in case you are looking for a late night snack, emergency medicines etc.... prices are reasonable. Location: The location is right next to the Stemmons Freeway with easy on/off access on I-35E. I would highly recommend this property and when returning to dallas, for the rate of $89 bucks a day, i would definetely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “They Know How to Do It”
Reviews.Author: kathyhouston
Reviews.Content: This is about our 10th visit and nothing ever changes. The front desk reception is very friendly, the sleeping rooms are spotless and you can actually get a good night's sleep. I know the hotel was fully booked (due to the LSU/Oregon game),but the hotel is so well insulated above/below/side to side, that your room is fabulously quiet. We keep coming back for all of the above and also the great rates.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option for Dallas area”
Reviews.Author: bergcarrie
Reviews.Content: Definitely a nice Marriott property in Dallas. This place has free parking, a great lobby and restaurant, a really nice club lounge, and the rooms are nice and spacious (although the bathroom setup sometimes drives me nuts,,,hard to find the light). Staff has always been friendly. Hotel is definitely cost effective considering its location in Dallas, which is close to UTSW Medical Center and not far from downtown. About 20 minutes from DFW. Decent workout center too. And, there's a Whataburger near by. What else do ya need? Only thing I don't like: You have to pay for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “more than expected”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy5176
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to write about the Marriott Market Center in Dallas, TX. I have been a devote of the cheapest, family focused hotels over the past several years, for obvious reasons (Homewood Suites, being my favorite), however, I have had a career change and have entered the world of â€œroad warriorsâ€� and cannot say enough about this hotel. From the time you walk in you are greeted and treated well. I was able to get the concierge upgrade to my stay and it was like icing on the cake. The room was delightful with a seating area and a sofa that could fold out to a bed. Had a small kitchenette (however lacking a microwave and stove) but a nice fridge (hidden behind cabinet doors). Two flat screen TVâ€™s and a fair selection of channels. The desk area was nice and for me internet was free (due to company contract), however, it can cost up to $12.95 a day. The bed was large and comfortable. The sink was separate from the toilet and tub, which can be beneficial. The exercise area was well laid out with mirrored walls to make it look a lot larger than it is. But the machines were well available as was free ear buds to listen to the TVâ€™s attached to each machine. The lobby had flavored iced water in a nice pitcher, the bar area was well placed. The dining area was under construction so I could not see that, but they had set up the bar area and a conference room to accommodate the needs of their guests for dining. The concierge perk was very nice, it is open from 0630 to 2200. Had a very nice breakfast spread, a nice evening nosh area and some nice desserts. The staff were friendly and informative. It can be well worth the $30 extra cost for the perk (especially for 2 or more guests in a room, hint family). The courtesy shuttle staff were great and will take you within 5 miles of the hotel at no charge (not on a schedule either). I did not get to use the pool but it looked nice and had a small hot tub. Overall, I was very impressed! The only negative was the card-key-lock system which caused several frustrations, but they were more than willing to change my cards as needed. My colleagues recommended this hotel and they were extremely correct. For the price, location and perks, you cannot beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best -- staff.”
Reviews.Author: James Q
Reviews.Content: This was the most friendly and accommodating staff I have ever experienced while traveling on business. They treat like you are on a cruise ship...

Reviews.Title: “It's nice”
Reviews.Author: 5shing7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night. The room was spacious and the bed was clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was a full breakfast so it was pretty good. They even make an omelet for you. I also used their free shuttle service to get to the attractions downtown. There wasn't any wait time and the driver is friendly and on time. Overall, it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Easy Stay”
Reviews.Author: barkwood66
Reviews.Content: Convenient to downtown, just 5mins away. Free parking is a plus. Lobby is very inviting and well maintained. All rooms are suites. Room is clean and comfortable. Internet access is pricey at $12.95, but that's consistent with a Marriott. I've stayed here many times but this is my first review. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: TJW3935
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! The rooms are very comfortable, relaxing, and peaceful. We ordered room service for breakfast and It was very good, they give you alot of food. Every member of staff we came into contact with were very helpful and accommodating. The hotel is located off i35, which has traffic day and night, but the windows are well insulated, so you can't hear any noise. Note to future guests at the Marriott Suites Dallas Market Center, use Kayak.com to book your room. The normal nightly rate is $199 a night and by using kayak, we got it for $71.00 with our AAA card. It was $89 without AAA. Still a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Mjtaylor409
Reviews.Content: Great stay for the price!!! It's clean it's nice it's decorated beautifully and the rooms are gorgeous. The pics don't do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “Courtyard Suites”
Reviews.Author: HUTraveler02
Reviews.Content: I travel alot for business and while this is a new Marriott Suites hotel, it reminded me of a Courtyard with suite rooms. I have stayed at some of the older Marriott Suites that have been renovated that are much nicer than this. Also a little disappointed when I called for a toothpaste twice and waited for 45 min, before I decided to go to the front desk to get it myself. Overall the stay was average, but for the great rate which included breakfast, I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Average Marriott Decor and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lillah19
Reviews.Content: I travel for business and spend a lot of nights in Marriotts. I have a definite idea of what to expect from a Marriott property and this property meets but does not exceed those standards. However, opinions are subjective as I overheard other travelers raving about the rooms and the breakfast buffet. These were families with children and not adult only travelers. The rooms are very standard small "suites" with basic hotel furnishings and a decent bed. There are two flat screens but the reception was fuzzy. If you need to be in this area the Marriott Suites is a decent choice but for a few dollars more I found the Renaissance across the street to be superior to this property. Overall, a clean average property but nothing to get excited about.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotel suites I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: troy mcclure
Reviews.Content: This is an easy one. -Service was solid the whole time-with moments of greatness. -Love the room, only thing it lacked was a microwave and free internet. -The bed was sublime. SUBLIME. -The pool wasn't heated-which surprised me a bit...and you have to go through the bar area-poor design-but it looked like a nice pool. -Shuttle to downtown was great. Both drivers were friendly and knew the area well. Tip them well for sure!!! -Dallas was interesting-but not worth leaving the bed for =) -Parking was free and the hotel pretty easy to get to. It was a great hotel stay-I really miss that bed and the great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not a Marriott attitude”
Reviews.Author: lalotp
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great in terms of facilities. Free parking is adequate and secure. I had a spacious room and almost everything was in greart working ocndition. Did not try the bar/restaurant, but it looked like a great placve for cocktails. Problems are with the service. I checked in at night close to midnight. Front desk person had a no-can-do attitude. I just did not feel welcome as i was not offered water nor a wake up call. Very cold person at front desk. The following day, whenever I called the front desk to request information about services available, the staff would sound tired (I spoke with at least 4 different people) and no one ever says who they are. The following day I called front desk for a wake up call. Person who answered seemed really tired and/or unhappy. Called later as the desk phone in my room did not work. It took 2.5 hours and 3 calls before it was fixed. The first 2 times I did not know who answered. By the third time I made sure to ask whom I was talking to. (A different person answered every time.) Mabel identified herself and finally someone showed up within 5 minutes of my call and fixed my phone in 5 minutes. As I understood the hotel was at 100% capacity. I requested a shuttle ride to Love Field airport... With the hotel at 100% capacity, the hotel only had one driver scheduled. I know this because the reception staff kept complaining about this out loud. The ride to the airport I requested becuase knowing the shuttle would be impossible, I decided to rent a car. In all the hotel is great, the FRONT DESK staff I interacted with is not. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Food”
Reviews.Author: Strick3
Reviews.Content: Room was great, fair price. Food was mediocre in room service and concierge room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: angelreborn
Reviews.Content: Stayed their for a quick weekend trip. The hotel is nice. All of the rooms are suites with a frig. Only no microwave! The staff waa friendly and great service. Free parking. The location is a few miles from Love Field airport. Not much to do around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We've Ever Stayed In!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTheBeach415
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and this is by far the best hotel we've stayed in. The hotel was immaculate and very colorful not only in the lobby but the guestrooms as well. The entire staff was super friendly and very helpful in finding things to do in Dallas. They also offer a free shuttle for about a 5 mile radius and there was not a wait for rides even on New Year's weekend despite the hotel being booked. The hotel itself was about a mile from downtown Dallas but it can be a lttle stressful driving when we didn't know where to go so the shuttle was a great asset for sightseeing. We had breakfast included in the already incredible rate that we got for the weekend and it was delicious...made to order waffles and omelettes as well as fresh pastries and fruit, juices and coffee. Now for the guestroom....we had a King Suite and it was gorgeous! The bed and linens were so comfortable and we had 2 huge flatscreen TVs!! I really can't say enough great things about this hotel I would recommend this to anyone traveling to the Dallas area!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Aquaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights with a family of 5, including 3 children. We were attending an event at the American Airlines Center on the weekend and wanted something close by. This is just off the freeway about a mile or so down the road. They have a shuttle to the AA center, but it stops at 10 pm, so any nighttime event will put you taking a cab back. Cab ride was about $12 I think. It's not really a walkable area, but there were a ton of restaurants about 3-5 miles down the road. The room is more like a "junior suite" with beds and a sitting area that is not really separate. The bathroom is in a corner and opens on two sides. The layout of the room was weird, and didn't really leave you anywhere to open a suitcase, and there was too much furniture to move around in order to open the sofa bed. The rooms were clean, and everything worked. There was a flat screen TV, but no HD programming, so the picture was terrible. We only had 3 towels both days and had to ask for extras, but they arrived promptly. The beds were ok, but not the most comfortable. We originally booked one night and extended our stay with no problems - the front desk was very good. Our rate included a buffett breakfast, and it was delicious - made to order omelets and waffles, some fruit, cereal, pastries, eggs, biscuits, the works. For a good or weekend rate, I would recommend. For their normal weekday rates you could probably find something better at that same price level, though.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: kentuckydavid
Reviews.Content: We met friends at the hotel. When we checked-in we went to our room and the first out our mouth was WOW. This was the best best we have had for several months. It was more than you expected, but we loved it. Everything was perfect. The staff was always ready and able to help you. They were eager to help you. It was a shame we had to leave, but life goes on. Kentucky Dave

Reviews.Title: “Much more than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: peridottopaz
Reviews.Content: We had a 6th floor room with a king size bed. Our room had a living room with flat screen tv, desk with internet plugin, couch and chair...a bedroom with french doors and a king size bed with big square feather pillows (found spare pillows later on in the closet), another big flat screen tv, huge chest of drawers, an alarm clock and plenty of outlets conveniently placed on the bedside lamps for cell phone charging, and super thick curtains to block out the lights, the bed was super comfy and firm and the comforter was down and the linens felt very clean...we had a dressing spot with a vanity sink and mirrors, a closet with plenty of room to hang things, and the doors on the closet were mirrored...a bathroom with a spacious bathtub and super clean floors and toilet, plenty of plush towels and hotel toiletries (bath and body works brand)...a mini-kitchenette with coffee pot, stuff to make coffee and glass cups. We turned out air conditioning to a chilly 68 degrees. We were right down the road from Medieval Times, which is the reason we got the hotel, to be nearby our destination. It was very easy to get to the hotel and the parking was great! We stayed on a Saturday night. Our room cost was 89.99 plus tax..total was 103.00. We had a wonderful time and loved our stay (even ordered in pizza from the dominos around the block). We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Just finished 2 nights at this hotel for a purely leisure trip. The lobby area is beautiful, no doubt about it. As a Marriott Gold, I was put on the 12th floor Executive level & was somewhat surprised at just how much freeway noise did come thru even 12 floors up, but still slept very well. Beds are quite comfy w/nice euro-square pillows which makes it easy to sit in bed & read or watch tv. Speaking of that, picture quality on the tv not the greatest-not sure if that was because of the tv itself or position in the room (right in front of the window). Channel line-up was also quite limited. Mini-fridge in the room along w/coffee maker & wet bar, but no microwave. Bathroom was an interesting arrangement w/the bathtub & toilet being separate, but the closet & sink just off the sitting room w/no door, though from a peek thru an open door of another room, this may have had more to do w/the fact that I had a 2 DBL room vs. a king. This may also explain why there was only 1 tv in the room, as well. Since it was a holiday weekend, the Executive lounge was closed but the hotel provided a coupon for complimentary breakfast in the restaurant. All in all, would definately consider a return visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep”
Reviews.Author: goingthedistance89
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful nights sleep each night here. The beds are very comfortable! The rooms were perfect for me to spread out for my work at night. Everyone delivered personal, friendly service the entire week I was there and made my stay enjoyable. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kathyhouston
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here and it gets better each time. The value is outstanding, the property is incredibly clean and fresh and the rooms are extremely quiet. We continue to stay here because even though you see lots of people in the lobby and dining outlets, you never see busy hallways or hear any unnecessary noise. The front desk staff are quick on the check-in/check-out paperwork and were extremely helpful in helping with dining recommendations. Just a very nice place that seems to maintain its quality -- and possibly improve it on a regular basis. I would commend management as doing their job extremely well.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Grnwayrob
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here while in Dallas on business. I was in a king suite, which was nice and spacious, and had 2 very nice 42" flatscreen LG televisions. The room, as well as the public areas was spotless. Very quiet as well, even with a laarge freeway right out front. My colleague staying in a different room found one of here tv's not working, after reporting the issue it was repaired within 10 minutes! Dinner at the hotel's restaurant was actually very good, in terms of selection and quality. Ordered breakfast from room service via the door card with a requested arrival of 7 to 7:15. They were at my door with breakfast promptly at 7am sharp. Everything I received was exactly as ordered. My only complaints would be that the wine list in the bar was filled with very middling quality wines with prices at least 5x retail. Additionally wireless internet is $12.95 a day. This is starting to be annoying to pay $10+ a day for internet at full service hotels, while their value-brand little sisters usually include this for free. Overall though, I would say that the customer service at this property exceeds expectations. A very pleasant place to stay in the Market Center/Downtown area of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: alanscottus
Reviews.Content: I originally made reservations at the Marriott Suites Market Center because the Renaissance, Starwood Suites, and the Hilton Anatole were all full due to some Conventions. But I don't see how I could have had a more pleasant stay there than at the Marriott: The room was spacious and comfortable, well designed, impeccably clean, and quet; the Concierge lounge was well provided, and both room service and the restaurant were excellent; the staff was helpful and the parking convenient and abundant. The next time I want to be near either the Market Center or Southwestern, I see no reason to stay anywhere else than at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Traveluxx
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Marriott property. Very nice room even more comfortable bed. It is a two room suite. Quiet even though it's off the highway which makes it a conveinant location. No stores or restaurants within walking distance. Good breakfast buffett. Parking is free but they charge $13,00 per day for wireless free in the lobby and they have a 4 desk business room with computers and copy machines. I would recommend this hotel but if I returned to Dallas I would probably stay downtown or somewhere there is stores or restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sundown721
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome, one good thing is you didn't have to pay for parking, but you did have to pay for internet which was a pain. $12.95 a day. I stayed in a king suite, it was very comfortable and a very large room. My bed was in a different room from the common area room, and both rooms had 42" or 47" TV's!!! Hotel was great, I loved it, will stay here again, plan on dining out because hotel restaurant is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kclark032
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel many times over the past two years, with the latest being Feb 2010. The rooms are VERY large, spacious suites with excellent layout, 2 flatscreens, large fridge, microwave upon request (<5 min delivery), coffee maker, luxurious bed & bedding. Quiet & dark with blackout blinds. Large windows otherwise. Lobby is modern, attractive & well-furnished; bar area is the same. Brennan the bartender knows his trade! Excercise facility is super; breakfast is not cheap but is among the best. Location is great, relative to restaurants on Cedar Springs, Lemmon, McKinney, Oak Lawn, Knox/Henderson or downtown - all are w/in 15 minutes. Katy trail is also 12 minutes away. Only negative: round the hotel is nothing, so if you want to take a stroll, better drive to Katy Trail or do so on one of the 4 treadmills in the health facility (or 2 bikes, mats, free weights, machines & 7 TVs). The fresh 'fruit water' in the lobby can quench your thirst.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: VikingNZaffer
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight for a flight connection, and it was beyond our expectations. The suite had 2 enormous flat screen TVs (one in the lounge, one in the bedroom)! Fully stocked fridge/bar and coffee maker were appreciated. The staff were very friendly, and very helpful in helping us find a restaurant downtown. The hotel also runs a free shuttle service to restaurants in a 5 mile radius, which was most welcome! It is located just next to I-35, but for us it made it easier to get from the airport, get to where we needed to be, and get back to the airport the next day. We would stay here again if passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: chhelms
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in to our check out, we were pleased with everything about this hotel. The rooms are spacious, well-designed, clean and fresh. Both the sitting area and bedroom had large flatscreen TV (which made my husband very happy!). A wet bar with small refrigerator are included in suite. We had lots of activities every day but alsways arrived back at our hotel happy for the peaceful setting and our comfortable room & bed. We used many of the services including room service, breakfast in the restaurant, the lobby bar, the fitness center & the complimentary shuttle. Everything was in good order. In the fitness center they even managed to have headsets for the treadmills, water, a boom box for music, magazines, towels, etc. Every detail and need had been considered. Food was good both from room service and restaurant (breakfast). Shuttle driver took us to dinner as well as to another hotel. Service was friendly and efficient. They could not have been more accomodating and this was busy New Year's Eve/Cotton Bowl weekend. Highly recommend! Excellent value. Thanks Dallas Marriott Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - one of my favourites...”
Reviews.Author: tredders_UK
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Marriott Market Suites a couple of times on business, and always really enjoy it there. Staff are excellent - very efficient and friendly, and check-in took no more than a couple of minutes. Suites are fantastic - big sitting room with sofa and comfy chairs, big plasma TV, desk and chair for working, and a little kitchenette (with fridge, coffee maker etc), and then a big bedroom with another huge plasma, massive comfy bed, and a few nice touches like a clock radio with iPod dock. Decent sized bath and shower, and excellent air con (which is really important in Dallas!) complete the facilities. Bar has a good selection of local beers, and the bar-staff are friendly and chatty. Breakfast is the usual great Marriott standard - large buffet selection and cooked-to-order omelette bar. Again, the staff are outstanding - by the 3rd morning, the waitress was bringing me coffee and juice and was asking if I wanted my "usual breakfast"! The hotel was refurbed a couple of years ago, and it's immaculate. It's also very handy for the American Airlines Center - I took in a couple of hockey games, and it's a $10 taxi ride away. I'll definitely stay here again on my next business trip, and wouldn't hesitate to bring the family here for a holiday, too.

Reviews.Title: “A-kon convention”
Reviews.Author: AshleyG3
Reviews.Content: even though it was indeed very crowded; i enjoyed it very much, the rooms were nice and comfy *this test was made by jumping up and down on the bed ^^*

Reviews.Title: “Safe, comfortable hotel but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: JoeysTrips
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three times in September 2009 and have enjoyed being there every time. I would agree with other reviewers that the location is very poor and the side access road is one-way so it is a pain to get to it. It is right next to 35 so this makes it easy to get to downtown Dallas within 10 minutes. They have a very flexible shuttle service and can take you within a 5 mile radius for free so this is helpful. I do like the cleanliness of the rooms and the relatively quiet atmosphere. Some of the rooms have very old A/C systems that can make a lot of noise so watch out. They have a pretty good business rate which includes the internet and breakast restaurant options in addition to the conceirge lounge. Microwaves are complimentary here so this is nice. There are a couple of things I have found a little annoying about this hotel. First of all, the breakfast options are among the worst of Marriott options I have ever seen. Although there is a restaurant and a conceirge lounge, the breakfast options never change and are usually always cold. I also found the omelette station to be low on ingredients and quality of cooking. They advertise having a better conceirge lounge than it really is. There are never newspapers or magazines as advertised for the lounge and it is not open 24x7 like you would expect it to be. Newspapers are not delivered by default to your room so you must ask for this in order to get it. Overall, I will stay there again but I am tempted to try other hotels in the area too.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites”
Reviews.Author: LearjetPilot
Reviews.Content: Our flight crew stayed here six times June - September. It is, by far, one of our favorite hotels. The staff is top notch (took 2 minutes to check in). The rooms are clean, very comfortable, and just about perfect. The rate is pretty respectable considering the accommodations. My only complaint would be the $12.95 plus tax per day for mediocre internet service.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - WAS BLOWN AWAY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adventure-seeker112
Reviews.Content: I've been all over the US and in other countries. Finding a hotel this exceptional is rare!!! First of all, the staff was lovely. They went out of their way to accommodate our needs and were very friendly. My fiance and I were at the Superpages.com Center seeing a concert. We called the hotel from the concert to see what time their bar closed. Unfortunately, it was going to be closed by the time we returned. However, the staff read us the wine menu over the phone and gave us prices! They were more than happy to stick glasses and a bottle of wine in our room for us while we were away. When we got back it was waiting for us in the refrigerator. Earlier that evening the gal at the front desk even spent 10 minutes helping us choose a place to eat dinner and looked up directions for us. Overall they were awesome!! As far as cleanliness goes - the hotel was spotless; excellent. I am a CLEAN FREAK, and this hotel met my standards (hard to do). The hotel was renovated in 2007, and it shows! It looks like it is brand new and has such a classy, contemporary feel. I also felt VERY SAFE and at home here. After 11 pm, the hotel requires that you have a room key to access the main door to the front lobby. Otherwise, you have to ring a bell to gain access by a hotel staff member. It was in a good area of town as well. The room was very comfortable too!!! We could have slept on that bed for an entire day. We did not want to leave! The pillows were also great - not too hard, not too soft. This always seems to be a problem I have when I travel, but I was pleasantly surprised this time. Also, the 2 giant flat screen TVs in the suite made things comfortable as well. And the lovely view of Dallas from our window was romantic. I have absolutely NO COMPLAINTS about this hotel. PAY THE PRICE TO STAY HERE - IT IS WORTH IT!!!! I will definitely be staying here again next time I visit the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lchaustin
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by a nicely done renovation....the furnishings and decor is modern and sleek and the flat screen TVs a plus. Will definitely stay here again, but a as a road warrior I have a couple suggestions: UPDATE THE WORK OUT ROOM. The falling apart stairmasters and treadmills with DYI individual screen on the equipment is calling out for a change. Also - the TV selection shows that they are still forgetting that 1/2 the travelers are woman. If you're going to have 6 ESPN stations (ie: ESPN, ESPN 2, ESPN Classic, etc) throw me a bone and have a working AE / Bravo / HGTV / Food Network......it's only fair!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay during Market”
Reviews.Author: Lilly_Fox
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good place to stay during our trip to the Dallas Market. There were four of us that went and we couldn't have had a better time. We all arrived a different times, but we had made arrangments with the hotel for their shuttle. The shuttle got delayed in picking up one person so the hotel said to take a cab and they paid for it. The bar is a nice place to relax and have a drink after a long day. The service was friendly and prompt. We didn't eat in the restaurant on this trip. The room was very clean and when we called down for more towels, they were there within five minutes. We arranged for the hotel to take us Downtown one night for dinner. They were very accomodating and left us with a phone number to call when we were ready to depart. We left our luggage at the front desk on our last day. The staff was more than helpful in helping us load everything when we finally left. This was a great location for us during our Dallas trip and we will stay again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, roomy hotel, but awkward location”
Reviews.Author: Travel159549
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel for a recent weekend because it was highly rated on TripAdvisor and reasonably priced. We enjoyed our experience - we paid about $79/night and received a nice king-bed suite. The hotel was very clean, had two flat screen TVs (one in the "living room" and the other in the bedroom). There is access to the bathroom from both the bedroom and the living room. Unlike prior reviews, we did not have a problem with noise, though we were on the backside of the hotel (the non-highway side). The views are not impressive (essentially a flat landscape of empty lots), and the access to the free is convenient, but can be a little confusing (access roads/one way streets/etc). The fitness room was very impressive (several treadmills, stairsteppers, medicine balls, TVs, towels, water - in addition to several machines and a separate room with free weights up to 60 pounds). The staff were very friendly and helpful. The "business center" only had two computers and printers, but we didn't have a problem getting on them when needed. The parking lot was spacious and free. The primary downside to the hotel is the location - there is nothing that you would want/need within walking distance (in fact, walking in the area is probably not a good idea unless you're comfortable with it), as the area is industrial (and butted up against a highway, with a medical facility just on the other side). Very quick access to downtown (assuming you have a car).

Reviews.Title: “Sleek hotel at a fab price, but a pretty boring location”
Reviews.Author: Olivia99
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was wonderful. Beautiful lobby with fresh flowers. Great staff who were extremely helpful in recommending restaurants. The room was spacious and extremely clean. Everything looked brand new. My sister especially liked the bed. I thought mine was fine, but she really was raving about it. One tiny thing: There's definitely a little traffic noise. We heard some sirens around 11 p.m. both nights, but we weren't yet asleep. I'm not sure if they would have woken us up. And you could definitely hear the freeway. The only real downsides for us were the location and the restaurant at breakfast. The location was very convenient to find because it's right on the 35 freeway, but there's nothing at all within walking distance. I should have researched what "Market Center" actually was. I thought it was a shopping area, which my sister and I would have enoyed, but it's actually just a convention center type thing. And it's still not within walking distance. But that's probably mostly my fault. I just wish we had stayed somewhere where we could walk to things. About the restaurant for breakfast: We only ate their one morning. The food was quite good. I had the part of the buffet that was only cold items plus oatmeal. The fruit was absolutely excellent. Some of the best I've had in a while. And the oatmeal was delicious. But it was $13. Slightly pricey, but not a huge deal. The problem really was with the service. There was no one there to seat us, so we just decided to seat ourselves. And then we had to get up and go talk to someone because they still weren't seeing us after several minutes. The service took forever in general. We saw several people standing in line for at least five minutes to get an omelette. The person making them seemed to disappear for 10 minutes at a time and show up when no one needed her services.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Best staff ever.”
Reviews.Author: deBoer75
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three days during our trip from Dallas to Memphis. Beside the fact that the hotel is close to downtown it also has a great staff. They helped us to get tickets for the Mavericks ( great experience) and always tried to make our stay pleasant. The rooms are big enough and the beds were great. So too all the travelers from Europe and especially from the Netherlands if you want to visit Dallas book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice and roomy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Apert
Reviews.Content: Nice and roomy..nicely decorated and the beds are comfy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: whateverintexas
Reviews.Content: This is a really clean and very comfortable hotel with nice mini-suites! The king bed was outstandingly comfy and clean, and shower worked wonderfully, and the hotel is extremely quiet and relaxing. The roomservice was also prompt and yummy, and the bar downstairs mixes a nice drink. This is a really nice place to stay, and, although it's right on the freeway, you can't hear it in your room.

Reviews.Title: “The Suites are sweet”
Reviews.Author: VegasBizTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Great experience! Clean, quite, great staff, awesome room!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: flyonblue
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Suites is an excellent choice if visiting the Dallas area for three main reasons. 1) Free shuttle service: parking can be expensive and they will drive you and pick you up from anywhere in a 5 mile radius. 2) Great rooms: the extra living room space and color palate really increased the enjoyability factor of our stay. 3) Free breakfast: make sure you book your room with a free breakfast. Not only was it delicious but the service was extravagant. Please note that internet does not come for free at the Marriott but that there is a business center with a printer attached as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: stever817
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 year old son and I arrived after a 10 hour drive from St Louis. First word of advice, get off the freeway one exit sooner then your NAV system says :). Check in was a breeze. We had a King suite room which was fantastic with private TV, dressing areas, warm comfy bed and amazing bedding. Our 2 year old loved the view of the city from the room. Due to our late arrival, we did not have any dinner, but the resturant stayed open for us which was a pleasent surprise since we did not want to get in the car again to drive for a meal. We utilitzed the swimming pool and hot tub onsite and that was refreshing. This is a 4 star hotel, but the size and comfort of the room are 5 star quality. If in Dallas again, this would be our 1st choice for where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: Southern_girl012
Reviews.Content: With the Marriott name, you know you are going to get your money's worth and more. This Marriott did not disappoint. Even with a room facing the interstate, I had a very peaceful sleep. Since the room was a suite, this made for any easier working session with my fellow travelers. We piled into one room and knocked out all the details of several projects. The rooms are spacious, the beds are heavenly, and the bathroom is very clean. The bar manager was very helpful in providing us dinner suggestions and even made our reservations. A hotel shuttle will take you where you need to go within a 15 minute radius of the hotel, and come back and pick you up...free of charge. The lobby and bar area have a trendy feel but not over the top. The food...always a good menu and the servers are always friendly. You can't go wrong with this Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anewsbud
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in early March, 2008. Great room at a great rate! I love the location and access. The room was just the right size. I found the staff to be very friendly and on the ball. I had several packages shipped to me before arrival, which always concerns me, but they showed up in great shape and the staff informed me right at check-in that the packages had arrived. I highly recommend Marriott Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriott”
Reviews.Author: jpetralia
Reviews.Content: I do have to say that I stayed at the Marriott Suites mainly because that is what our agency booked for us, and most likely because a couple of our other favorites were completely booked. Pros: This hotel was immaculate. There were four elevators that got me up to the 8th floor in a matter of seconds. Also, the staff was very helpful: I called the front desk at around 3:30 AM for a packet of regular coffee and got it in about 3 minutes. Cons: The pillows, probably in an effort to be fashionable, were squares, and smaller than a standard pillow. They were quite comfortable, but only when my head was completely on it, which was a challenge. Also, the towels are similar to those you'd find at a Quality Inn or some other lower level hotel -- definitely not what I'd expect to see when paying over $200 a night.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: pacajun
Reviews.Content: We booked a training event at the property. What a GREAT property. Staff were attentive and responsive, rooms were HEAVENLY a!nd the food was great. Drinks in the bar are pricey. And they will take you down to the West End where there is a great bunch of restaurants. Overall, wonderful! Would be unbelievable if the internet was not soo pricey

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CDandRW
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights when attending the NSDC conference. The conference was held at the Hilton Anatole but after reading reviews and positive past Marriott experiences we decided on the Market Suites. The rooms were nice and clean. I did not care for the bathroom layout, but that was minor. Please note there is nothing in walking distance but there is a complimentary shuttle. The service was superb. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. The restaurant servers were great. The shuttle driver Johnny was the best. He was informative, friendly and went above and beyond. He had great suggestions for restaurants and when he drove us to a restaurant he walked us in, talked to a manager and made sure we had the next available table!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott safe bet for comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Matty07uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Marriott Suites and had booked the Romance package. Good value for money and room was fine plenty of room for just the two of us. We should have been given vouchers for breakfast but did not find out until after first day but quickly sorted by hotel. Staff were efficient and friendly. Would benefit by upgrading TV/Hi Fi but minor point. Also used the Hotel shuttle in the evenings to go out to eat which was great as we could enjoy a drink. Johnny Ray was our driver every night and just trust his recommendations, he took us to some great places at different costs and ensured we either jumped the queues or got complimentary appetisers/desserts!! Downtown was only 5 - 10 minutes drive and we found parking during the day easy to find and cheap. We also stayed for a night later in the week at Embassy Suites Love Field and Rennaissance which just confirmed what good value the Marriott Suites was, best of the lot.

Reviews.Title: “Fine stay at the Marriott Suites”
Reviews.Author: Kamtini
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Suites is a perfectly fine hotel in a convenient location. The set-up of the suite, which includes a seating area and desk seperate from the bedroom, is excellent for business stays. The hotel is well-decorated and the staff is very professional. The only downside, as other reviewers have noted, is that there is nothing (restaurants, stores, etc.) within walking or short driving distance of the hotel (you generally have to get on the freeway to get anywhere). As Dallas traffic is terrible, this is a bit of a downside. I might consider staying here if returning but would likely check out the many hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Dallas is a Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: DCflyboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a solid, high-end place. The room is a very spacious suite of two rooms with a lot of comfortable space and furniture to relax. Room service was fast and good -- only drawback is that it ends at 11:00 PM. My highest marks go to hotels with some type of 24 hour food service. The location is a bit odd -- there is no place accessible via walking. This is a car accessible place only -- it is in a highway corridor with a number of other very large hotels. However, the drive to the heart of downtown was less than 10 minutes -- very convenient. The room was VERY clean and orderly. The lobby and restaurant were simple and nice. The room would be excellent for two friends traveling together or for a couple, as one person could go to bed, with the other watching TV or reading in the other room. Nice set-up.

Reviews.Title: “TripAdvisor does not steer you wrong! Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BigDogCT
Reviews.Content: This Marriott hotel is rated at a class 4 hotel, but it is really a 5 or 6 class rating. The hotel does not give itself enough credit. As a silver elite Marriott member this hotel was very impressive. I chose this hotel because of the reviews I read on Trip Advisor and it did not disappoint. Only a few minutes from the West End (cobble stone, historic, restaurant area) by car. This hotel also offers a free shuttle service to the airport, West End & Uptown. Also check out the Uptown area, a more trendy area with more bars, & restaurants. Great location. Rooms are suites with a set of French doors separating the bedroom from sitting room. Great room & service for the price. Mini kitchen area, sink, refrigerator, & coffee maker. My only compliant was the business center did not provide computer Internet service for free. Although hotel is wired for wireless which is free in public areas, I just did not have my lap top with me.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: AUTUMNSUN
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice Marriott. All the staff were really friendly and service oriented. I booked a room with two beds which is what i recieved. The problem was that there were no french doors to seperate the living area from bedroom. It was all one big room. I had planned to to have a little privacy from the kids but oh well! Maybe you only get the french doors ifs its a king room. I would ask if its important to you. How could I forget those comfortable beds ......Very comfy with nice linens. I also noticed there was just one tv in the room.The room was clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was large. The pool was nice and stayed open late, great for the kids. This hotel sits next to a busy freeway but we did not notice any outside noises. Also there is a tiny store with some snacks and other supplys by the front desk. We arrived late and left early so I didnt get to utilize any of the hotels other services. I was not disappointed with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, impressed”
Reviews.Author: businesstrvlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for pleasure one weekend in March, and selected the hotel for its location. I've stayed at plenty of Marriotts and wasn't expecing much from this one since it is not a 4 star property. I was really surprized however that this hotel was as nice as other Marriotts and the rooms were bigger! The suite style with a sitting area seperate from the bedroom was very nice. I liked this place and would stay there again for pleasure in a heartbeat. Excellent location close to down town and good food. The staff was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveller44
Reviews.Content: Went by the previous ratings of this hotel on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. Stayed here 10-12 Aug 07. Overall, an excellent hotel, quick check-in/check-out, very clean rooms, reliable housekeepers, and good food. Rooms are spacious (all suites)... I highly recommend this hotel for leisure and business travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...I am a Marriott follower now.”
Reviews.Author: flipstrips
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Dallas for a friend's grand opening of a restaurant in uptown... The Fish. We travel somewhat frequently and usually go to non-chain hotels to get a unique experience from the city we are visiting. Since this trip was last minute trip, I hesitantly picked Marriott Market Center for its location and price. Well...I will now look for a Marriott hotel anywhere I go because of our experience at this hotel. The location was a short drive to most anywhere we went The hotel's decor was modern yet warm and cozy. The facilities were first rate from the restaurant to the pool to the room. Our suite with the king size bed was really amazing for the money. The best thing, however, was the service from EVERYONE - front desk & restaurant personnel, shuttle driver Johnny, and anyone else I forgot. Everything was above expectations... anytime we visit Dallas, it will be the Marriott Market Center.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Identity”
Reviews.Author: Ejwienen
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at a Marriott hotel. Although nice, I strongly urge that they furthur their budget in the security department. We stayed at Marriott Suites 2493 N. Stemmons Freeway Dallas,Tx 75207.Friday June 1 & 2, 2007. We had been at the hospital since Thursday evening with my brother in ICU. Exausted, with no sleep, and being constantly harrased by the homeless, and no where to go, and our home over an hour away, I reserved a room Friday night for 2 nights. Thinking this was a quality hotel, I was willing to pay for a more expensive hotel for the guality and safety that I thought they offered. But while we slept that Friday night, someone came into our room and stole mine and my mothers purses. Everything I practically owned was in that purse, drivers license, social security numbers and cards, bank cards, credit cards, medical cards...$200.00 worth of mp3 players. My mothers debit/credit card. My husband cancelled our bank card and credit cards that day. My dad cancelled theirs, but has continued to get reports of continued use of their card. They are now officailly, flat broke. We called the police,they made a report, but there are no leads. We filed a complaint to the claims department, in which we were told that the hotel had not filed a claim yet. The claims department sayed they would call us back , and they haven't. This should not have ever happened. We are extremly upset and highly disappointed in this hotel, and how this has been handled so far. We still have not been offered any compensation in any way. God forbid that this could have been someones child stolen out of the room, and they have to file it with the claims department. I pray this NEVER happens to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: grover_tx
Reviews.Content: I stay in Dallas a few nights every month on business. I have stayed at most of the name-brand hotels in the city (Marriott, Hilton/Doubletree, Hyatt, etc.) and the Marriott Suites at Market Center is my favorite. It is reasonably priced and the rooms are clean, updated and comfortable. You get a suite for the price of a regular room at most comparable places. I especially liked the comfortable bed and the fact that the shades block almost all outside light. Room service overall is very good - food was good if not spectacular, but breakfast came on time and service was very friendly. In fact, service was very friendly from the front desk, housekeeping staff and everyone else I encountered. Plenty of free parking in the outside lot, and the location is very good. I highly recommend this hotel to business travelers looking for a very spacious, clean, comfortable, convenient hotel in the $225 range. The rates on the weekend (I haver seen $129 advertised) are a real bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dazzor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for seven nights. Fantastic service. I hope the team at this hotel stay the same. This is what Marriott all about. Excellent

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Strady
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have been there for two nights at the beginning of August. We arrived late at night (2a.m.) due to flight delay, and had no problem for checking-in. All the people at front desk are very helpful and kind. Great room, with a living room separated from the bedroom itself. Very clean and comfortable, the best bed we had in our 21days trip in the US. Service was good too. An excellent American breakfast was served in the morning, included in the room rate, both cold and warm dishes, with a chef at our disposal for omelettes and waffles. Wireless connection to Internet was available in the room, though NOT free of charge; anyway, a complimentary computer was available in the business center, near the lobby. A free car service is available to connect the hotel with downtown Dallas and the airport, except for Sunday. You just need to place a call to the hotel to have the car pick you up wherever you are in more or less 15 minutes and bring you back to the hotel. Of course, the hotel is NOT in walking distance to downtown, but almost all the other hotels we saw were in the same area. Overall, we spent a very nice time there and we would definitevely return if going to Dallas.

HotelInfo.Name: Marriott Suites Market Center Dallas
HotelInfo.Address: 2493 North Stemmons Freeway, Dallas, TX 75207
